title: Police: Boy shot in leg in NW Jacksonville
content:
JACKSONVILLE, Fla. - A juvenile male was shot in Northwest Jacksonville Friday night, the Jacksonville Sheriff's Office said.
Police responded to a boy shot in the leg about 9:30 p.m. on St. Clair Street.
The boy was taken to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries, police said.
JSO said they have not been able to question the boy, yet.
Witnesses said they heard gun shots, but never saw anything.
Police said there is no information on a suspect at this time.
Anyone who has any information or knows who may have shot the boy is asked to call the Sheriff's Office at 904-630-0500 or email JSOCrimeTips@jaxsheriff.org. To remain anonymous, contact Crime Stoppers at 1-866-845-TIPS.
